intro: Veronica plicata, commonly known as the folded speedwell, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and have a slightly serrated edge. Its flowers are small, blue or violet, and are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Veronica plicata thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks.
